tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1ch:24:04|24:5]].
Work that needs to be repeated, for example every day or every month.
"1,000s and of 100s" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
These two words share similar meanings and refer to all of the items and lands that the king owned. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
AT: "stood up" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
These two phrases share similar meanings and emphasize that David and the people of Israel are family. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: the ark of the covenant of Yahweh; a footstool for our God
tn.text: The second phrase defines the first phrase. Yahweh often refers to "the ark of the covenant" as his "footstool." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
AT: "a temple for me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: a man of war and have shed blood
tn.text: Both descriptions emphasize the same thing, namely that David had killed people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
AT: "have killed people" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
David continues speaking to the Israelites.
Possible meanings are 1) David and his descendants will rule Israel forever or 2) David will continue to be the king of Israel after he is resurrected from the dead.
AT: "the whole land of Israel" or "all the Israelites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: to sit on the throne of
tn.text: AT: "to rule over" or "to be the king of" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the kingdom of Yahweh, over Israel
tn.text: AT: "Israel, which is actually Yahweh's kingdom"
David continues to speak to the Israelites.
AT: "God said to me"
The word "house" refers to the temple of Yahweh.

tn.ref: I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father
tn.text: This does not mean that Solomon becomes an actual son of God, but it describes the personal relationship that he and God will have. AT: "I have chosen to treat him like a son, and I will be like a father to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These two words basically mean the same thing and refer to everything that Yahweh had commanded. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The word "you" here refers to David. AT: "just as you are committed this day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
David continues to speak to the Israelites.
This indicates that David starts a new phase in his speech.

tn.ref: keep and try to carry out
tn.text: The phrase "to carry out" means basically the same thing as "keep." Together the words emphasize importance of doing what God commands. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
AT: "your children who will take your place after you die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
David calls himself "your father" because this is a very formal occasion. AT: "my God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
AT: "completely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
AT: "willingly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: searches all hearts and understands every motivation of everyone's thoughts
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize that Yahweh knows the thoughts and motives of every person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: If you seek him, he will be found by you
tn.text: AT: "If you try to get Yahweh to pay attention to you, he will do so" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"See now" AT: "Remember" or "Be aware"
The word "strong" here refers to willpower and strength of character.
"temple porch" or "temple entrance." This refers to the columns that supported the roof at the entrance of the temple.
storerooms for valuable things
These were specific rules about how the priests and Levites should work in the temple.
This refers to the groups in which the priests and other temple workers were organized to fulfill their duties. See how you translated this term in [[:en:bible:notes:1ch:24:01|24:1]].
AT: "purified gold" or "extra valuable gold"

tn.ref: I have put all this in writing
tn.text: AT: "I wrote all of this down" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
AT: "helped me to understand the details of"
These two words basically mean the same thing and emphasize that Solomon must be courageous. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: Do not be afraid or anxious
tn.text: These two words basically mean the same thing and emphasize that Solomon must never give up. AT: "Be courageous" or "Be confident." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
AT: "will help you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: He will not leave you nor abandon you
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing and emphasize that Yahweh will always be with Solomon. AT: "He will always be with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: the divisions of the priests and Levites
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1ch:28:13|28:13]].
